avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 1200 m snow will fall until the early morning. Over a wide area 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. From early morning the wind will be moderate to strong.
Since Sunday avalanche prone wind slabs formed in particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at intermediate and high altitudes. These can be released by a single winter sport participant.
The fresh snow of yesterday as well as the deep wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence above approximately 2200 m.
Medium-sized and, in many cases, large dry avalanches are to be expected.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 50 cm of snow has fallen since Sunday. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. Backcountry touring calls for careful route selection.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 1200 m snow fell yesterday. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow significantly. In the course of the day sometimes large wind slabs will form.
The fresh snow of yesterday as well as the wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant,. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Medium-sized and large dry avalanches are to be expected.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs at elevated altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 15 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since the early morning above approximately 1500 m. The new snow can be released naturally in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow and wind slabs of yesterday represent the main danger. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
Medium-sized dry avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of the snowfall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow represents the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1600 m. In isolated cases new snow is lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area some new snow to above approximately 1000 m. Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry avalanches are possible as a consequence of the snowfall.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Down to 1000 m snow has fallen over a wide area.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow has fallen since yesterday. Over a wide area thus far only a little snow is lying.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust. These avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise. Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.
